name: NHS England
description: The lead commissioning organisation for the NHS in England, responsible for GBP 150B annual health spending and national programme delivery.

name: NHS Digital
description: The national provider of digital, data, and technology services for the NHS, delivering platforms used by millions of patients and clinicians.

name: Department for Education
description: UK government department responsible for children's services and education policy, including schools, further education, and apprenticeships.

name: Ministry of Defence
description: UK government department responsible for defence policy and the armed forces, with the largest single departmental procurement budget.

name: Home Office
description: Lead government department for immigration and passports, drugs policy, crime, fire, counter-terrorism, and police.

name: Cabinet Office
description: Supports the Prime Minister and ensures effective running of government, including civil service reform and public sector efficiency.

name: HMRC
description: UK tax authority responsible for collecting taxes, paying tax credits and child benefit, and enforcing customs regulations.

name: Department for Transport
description: Government department responsible for transport networks in England, with oversight of major infrastructure projects and franchising.

name: Environment Agency
description: Executive agency responsible for flood risk management, environmental regulation, and water quality across England.

name: Highways England
description: Government company responsible for operating, maintaining, and improving the strategic road network in England.

name: Network Rail
description: Owner and infrastructure manager of most of the railway network in Great Britain, managing 20,000 miles of track and 30,000 bridges.

name: Transport for London
description: Local government body responsible for the transport system in Greater London, operating the Tube, buses, and Overground.

name: Greater Manchester Combined Authority
description: Combined authority of ten metropolitan boroughs in Greater Manchester, responsible for transport, economic development, and housing.

name: Birmingham City Council
description: The largest local authority in Europe by population, currently undergoing a major transformation programme following Section 114 notice.

name: Leeds City Council
description: Metropolitan borough council serving over 800,000 residents, known for digital innovation and smart city initiatives.

name: Manchester City Council
description: Metropolitan borough council for the city of Manchester, driving major regeneration and smart city programmes.

name: Scottish Government
description: Devolved government of Scotland responsible for health, education, justice, transport, and economic development policy.

name: Welsh Government
description: Devolved government of Wales responsible for health, education, and public services. Committed to bilingual digital service delivery.

name: Metropolitan Police
description: The primary law enforcement agency for Greater London, the largest police force in the UK with over 34,000 officers.

name: Crown Commercial Service
description: Executive agency managing commercial agreements and procurement frameworks used across the public sector, facilitating GBP 30B+ annual spend.

name: Government Digital Service
description: Part of the Cabinet Office, GDS leads digital transformation across government including GOV.UK, One Login, and digital standards.

name: National Cyber Security Centre
description: Part of GCHQ providing cyber security guidance and incident response for UK organisations, both public and private sector.

name: UK Health Security Agency
description: Executive agency responsible for health protection through infectious disease surveillance, laboratory services, and emergency response.

name: Ofsted
description: Office for Standards in Education, inspecting and regulating services caring for children and young people and education providers.

name: Care Quality Commission
description: Independent regulator of health and social care in England, inspecting hospitals, care homes, GP practices, and dental surgeries.

name: NHS Greater Manchester
description: Integrated care system for Greater Manchester serving 2.8 million people, commissioning health and care services across 10 boroughs.

name: NHS West Yorkshire
description: Integrated care system covering Bradford, Calderdale, Kirklees, Leeds, and Wakefield with a combined population of 2.4 million.

name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust
description: One of the largest NHS trusts in the UK, running four hospitals including the Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham.

name: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust
description: Major NHS trust running five hospitals in west London, with a leading position in digital health research and clinical innovation.

name: Sheffield City Council
description: Metropolitan borough council serving over 580,000 residents with major capital programme covering regeneration and transport improvements.

name: Bristol City Council
description: Unitary authority for Bristol, known as a tech hub with active smart city and environmental sustainability programmes.

name: Edinburgh City Council
description: Local authority for Scotland's capital city, managing major infrastructure projects and cultural heritage preservation.

name: Cardiff Council
description: Local authority for the Welsh capital, delivering bilingual services and leading digital transformation across Welsh local government.

name: Nottingham City Council
description: Unitary authority for Nottingham city, managing regeneration programmes and shared services with partner councils.

name: Newcastle City Council
description: Metropolitan borough council in the North East, driving regional digital inclusion and smart transport initiatives.

name: Cornwall Council
description: Unitary authority for Cornwall, managing rural broadband infrastructure and sustainable energy procurement programmes.

name: Norfolk County Council
description: County council serving nearly 1 million residents, managing highways, education, social care, and environmental services.

name: Kent County Council
description: County council for Kent with 1.8 million residents, managing major transport infrastructure and social care services.

name: Belfast City Council
description: Local authority for Northern Ireland's capital, managing economic development, tourism, and community services.

name: NHS Scotland
description: Publicly funded healthcare system in Scotland providing healthcare to over 5.4 million people through 14 regional health boards.

name: NHS Wales
description: National health service for Wales providing healthcare through seven health boards and three NHS trusts.

name: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust
description: Major NHS teaching trust in central London, internationally recognised for clinical research and digital health innovation.

name: Barts Health NHS Trust
description: The largest NHS trust in England, running five hospitals in east London with an annual budget exceeding GBP 1.5B.

name: University of Cambridge
description: One of the world's leading research universities, managing significant capital programmes and technology procurement.

name: University of Oxford
description: World-renowned research university with extensive research computing infrastructure and capital development programmes.

name: University of Manchester
description: Russell Group university with major campus expansion and research computing infrastructure investment programmes.

name: Education and Skills Funding Agency
description: Executive agency of DfE responsible for funding education and training for children, young people, and adults in England.

name: Natural England
description: Executive agency advising government on the natural environment, responsible for conservation, biodiversity, and landscape management.

name: Forestry Commission
description: Government department responsible for protecting and expanding forests and woodlands across England.

name: Defence Science and Technology Laboratory
description: Executive agency of the MoD delivering scientific research for UK defence and security, based at Porton Down and Fort Halstead.

name: GCHQ
description: Intelligence and security organisation providing signals intelligence and information assurance to government and armed forces.

name: HM Courts and Tribunals Service
description: Executive agency responsible for administering criminal, civil, and family courts and tribunals in England and Wales.

name: HM Prison and Probation Service
description: Executive agency responsible for running prison and probation services in England and Wales, managing 117 prisons.

name: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
description: Executive agency maintaining registers of drivers and vehicles in Great Britain, processing 55 million driver records.

name: Food Standards Agency
description: Independent government department responsible for food safety and hygiene across England, Wales, and Northern Ireland.

name: Companies House
description: Executive agency incorporating and dissolving companies, examining and storing company information, and making it available to the public.

name: Land Registry
description: Government department registering ownership of land and property in England and Wales, holding 26 million titles.

name: Ordnance Survey
description: National mapping agency creating detailed maps and geospatial data for Great Britain, serving both public and private sectors.

name: UK Space Agency
description: Executive agency responsible for UK government space programme, delivering Earth observation, satellite communications, and launch capability.

name: Nuclear Decommissioning Authority
description: Government body responsible for decommissioning UK nuclear sites and managing radioactive waste, overseeing GBP 3.2B annual programme.

name: Defence Equipment and Support
description: Arms-length body of MoD responsible for procuring and supporting defence equipment, managing GBP 14B annual budget.

name: National Crime Agency
description: Law enforcement agency leading the fight against serious and organised crime including cybercrime, fraud, and trafficking.

name: Intellectual Property Office
description: Government agency granting IP rights for patents, designs, trademarks, and copyright, based in Newport, Wales.

name: Met Office
description: UK national meteorological service providing weather forecasts, climate science, and severe weather warnings using world-leading supercomputing.

name: Office for National Statistics
description: UK's largest independent producer of official statistics, responsible for the census and national accounts data.

name: British Library
description: National library of the United Kingdom with over 170 million items in its collection, undertaking major digital archive programme.

name: Historic England
description: Public body championing England's historic places, providing expertise on heritage conservation, listed buildings, and archaeological sites.

name: UK Atomic Energy Authority
description: Government research organisation leading the development of fusion energy, operating the MAST Upgrade and JET facilities.

name: Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency
description: Executive agency regulating medicines, medical devices, and blood components for transfusion across the UK.

name: Environment Agency Scotland (SEPA)
description: Scotland's environmental regulator responsible for protecting and improving the environment, managing flooding, and ensuring compliance.

name: National Health Service Business Services Authority
description: Arms-length body providing business support services to the NHS including pensions, prescriptions, dental services, and student bursaries.

name: Sellafield Ltd
description: Government-owned company responsible for safely decommissioning the Sellafield nuclear site and managing radioactive waste storage.

name: Financial Conduct Authority
description: Financial regulatory body operating independently of the UK government, regulating 50,000 financial services firms.

name: Liverpool City Council
description: Metropolitan borough council for Liverpool, managing major regeneration programmes and digital inclusion initiatives.

name: Sussex Police
description: Territorial police force covering East and West Sussex, managing collaborative technology programmes with Surrey Police.
